required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Electromyographic Activity of the Muscles of the Pelvic Floor Runners With Conventional Shoes and Minimalist.
clinical_study.official_title: Study Electromyographic Activity of the Muscles of the Pelvic Floor Runners With Conventional Shoes and Minimalist.

brief_summary.textblock:
JUSTIFICATION:
Urinary incontinence is highly prevalent among women who play high impact sports such as running. that observed one of the possible reasons for this high prevalence is delayed activation of the pelvic floor in relation to the abdominal muscles.
The use of minimalist shoes during the race produces changes in muscle and joint biomechanics and efficiency in the race. However, to date no studies evaluating the influence of footwear in the musculature of the pelvic floor during the race.
OBJECTIVE: Describe and compare the electromyographic activity of the muscles of the pelvic floor and abdominal during the race with conventional shoes and minimalist.
DESIGN: cross-over study experimental, analytical and prospective. METHODOLOGY: conventional and minimalist: 10 healthy young women, randomized into two groups to characterize the electromyographic activity of the muscles of the pelvic floor prior and during the race at 9 km / h with the two types of slippers are included.
an initial assessment in which it is confirmed that women meet the criteria for inclusion and exclusion will be made. the ability to run will be assessed a 10-minute treadmill at a speed of 9-13 km / h as well as the ability to properly contract the muscles of the pelvic floor.
The first group will race with conventional shoes and then minimal, while the second group will make the race with minimalist and after conventional shoes. Both groups have a washout period of 10 minutes between both interventions.
EMG recording are collect with electromyographic sensors musculature of the pelvic floor (by intravaginal probe germproof brand), abdominal (intern and oblique external oblique), erector spinae and gluteal (by surface sensor) in relation to the cycle gear, barographic recorded with sensors. The variables to be included in the electromyography for each muscle regarding the gait cycle will be, activation start, duration, intensity and synergy with its corresponding standard deviation.

primary_outcome.measure: Start of activation of the musculature of the pelvic floor during 30 seconds while running.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Basal, 5, 5.5, 6 minutes after the start of the test.
primary_outcome.description: PeriformTM vaginal probe Will collect the EMG activity of the muscles of the pelvic floor.Records are made in a single session with washout periods in accordance with previous studies that have collected the activity of the EMG activity PF during treadmill running different speeds.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of activation of the musculature of the pelvic floor during 30 seconds while running.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Basal, 5, 5.5, 6 minutes after the start of the test.
primary_outcome.description: PeriformTM vaginal probe Will collect the EMG activity of the muscles of the pelvic floor.Records are made in a single session with washout periods in accordance with previous studies that have collected the activity of the EMG activity PF during treadmill running different speeds.

primary_outcome.measure: Intensity of activation(mlv) of the musculature of the pelvic floor during 30 seconds while running.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Basal, 5, 5.5, 6 minutes after the start of the test.
primary_outcome.description: PeriformTM vaginal probe Will collect the EMG activity of the muscles of the pelvic floor.Records are made in a single session with washout periods in accordance with previous studies that have collected the activity of the EMG activity PF during treadmill running different speeds.

secondary_outcome.measure: Start of activation of the abdominal muscles, erector spine and gluteal during 30 seconds while running.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Basal, 5, 5.5, 6 minutes after the start of the test.
secondary_outcome.description: EMG activity also register bilaterally in erector spinal,rectus abdominis, internal oblique and the gluteus maximus EMG recordings will be made with Step32 system, electrical system dedicated to the analysis of normal and pathological march, whose main purpose document objectively and repetitive spatiotemporal characterizing walking and running parameters. Electromyographic sensors variable geometry will be used for recording because they ensure the stability of the signal, reduce noise produced by movement, interference by the mains frequency and microphonic phenomena connecting cable EMG activity be recorded in rest position standing for 2 s, serving as a reference point for analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of activation ofabdominal muscles, erector spine and gluteal during 30 seconds while running.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Basal, 5, 5.5, 6 minutes after the start of the test.
secondary_outcome.description: EMG activity also register bilaterally in erector spinal,rectus abdominis, internal oblique and the gluteus maximus EMG recordings will be made with Step32 system, electrical system dedicated to the analysis of normal and pathological march, whose main purpose document objectively and repetitive spatiotemporal characterizing walking and running parameters. Electromyographic sensors variable geometry will be used for recording because they ensure the stability of the signal, reduce noise produced by movement, interference by the mains frequency and microphonic phenomena connecting cable EMG activity be recorded in rest position standing for 2 s, serving as a reference point for analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensity of activation of the abdominal muscles, erector spine and gluteal during 30 seconds while running
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Basal, 5, 5.5, 6 minutes after the start of the tests.
secondary_outcome.description: EMG activity also register bilaterally in erector spinal,rectus abdominis, internal oblique and the gluteus maximus EMG recordings will be made with Step32 system, electrical system dedicated to the analysis of normal and pathological march, whose main purpose document objectively and repetitive spatiotemporal characterizing walking and running parameters. Electromyographic sensors variable geometry will be used for recording because they ensure the stability of the signal, reduce noise produced by movement, interference by the mains frequency and microphonic phenomena connecting cable EMG activity be recorded in rest position standing for 2 s, serving as a reference point for analysis

arm_group.description: The first group will race with conventional shoes and then minimalist shoes. The group run 5 minutes for warming and then 30 seconds at 9km/h, 30 seconds at 11km/h and 30 seconds at 13km/h. They have a washout period of 10 minutes between both interventions.

The second group will race with minimalist shoes and then conventional shoes. The group run 5 minutes for warming and then 30 seconds at 9km/h, 30 seconds at 11km/h and 30 seconds at 13km/h. They have a washout period of 10 minutes between both interventions.

intervention.intervention_name: Effect of pelvic floor for the use of minimalist shoes versus shod in woman.
intervention.description: Measure the activity of the pelvic floor and others muscles with EMG during treadmill running with different speeds and different shoes: minimalist and shod.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women aged 18 to 38 years.
- Nulliparous.
- Clinically healthy at the time of the study.
- Physically able for the requirement of the race on tape.
- Body Mass Index (BMI) 20-25 kg / m2
- Having signed the informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women.
- urogynecological dysfunction.
- Lower limb surgeries performed in the last six months.
- Not be able to make voluntary contractions of the pelvic floor standardized according to the Modified Oxford Scale

patient_data.ipd_description: All the researchers will participate in all the study phases.
